title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter Alvarinho (Alentejano)
description: A surprisingly fresh wine for an Alvarinho from the hot Alentejo. It shows crisp acidity, with lime and apricot flavors and a bright, crisp aftertaste.

title: Terras de Alter 2014 Terra d'Alter White (Alentejano)
description: This is an attractive, perfumed wine that is a blend of Síria, Arinto and Viognier. It's the Viognier that gives the perfumed character that makes it so distinctive. It's fruity, lightly textured and ready to drink.

title: Tiza 2013 Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: Earthy slightly grassy infusions work their way onto a hot energetic bouquet. This feels racy, drawing and a bit clampy, while woody spicy flavors of rubbery berry fruits finish bold and hot like the beginning.

title: Wedell Cellars 2012 Wavertree Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Deep raspberry, plump cranberry and licorice show on the nose of this well-constructed wine. A prominent cranberry spice hits the front of the palate and carries all the way into the finish, along with a bit of pencil shavings.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Carsi Vineyard Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Lemon and quince flavors characterize this crisp, dry, 100% varietal wine from a single vineyard site. It was fermented and aged in both stainless steel and oak, in addition to concrete egg. High-toned acidity remains sharp on the palate around a medium build and spicy finish.

title: Encanto 2014 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Aromas of lemon, green apple and wet stone make up the nose on this quaffable Godello that's solid on the palate, with some pithiness. Flavors of melon, apple and green banana finish with notes of lees, citrus pith and bitterness.

title: Fiuza 2014 3 Castas Red (Tejo)
description: The wine is young, still more structure than fruit. It has firm tannins as well as juicy blackberry fruits. A blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional, it is likely to age for a few months, so drink from the end of 2016.

title: Gemma 2011 Colarej  (Barolo)
description: This offers aromas and flavors of toasted oak, espresso, coconut, vanilla and a confectionary note but it lacks fruit richness. Bracing tannins provide the framework.

title: G&M; Machmer 2014 Bechtheimer Spätlese Gewürztraminer (Rheinhessen)
description: Whiffs of smoke and crushed minerals lend a savory tone to bright honey and tangerine flavors in this unusually styled Gewürztraminer. It's not varietally classic, but refreshingly brisk in acidity and quite quaffable. Drink now.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Pegos Claros Colheita Castelão (Palmela)
description: Still with its firm tannins in place and with layers of wood aging flavors, this is obviously a young wine. It has a background of ripe berry fruits and acidity that will develop over the next two years. It is potentially rich and full. Drink from 2017.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva Red (Douro)
description: The wine has a fat fruity texture along with acidity and plenty of tannins. It is austere in character, very dry and dense and with a serious intent. There is a juicy aftertaste that is more attractive and has promise for the future.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva

title: Campolargo 2013 Vinha do Putto Branco White (Bairrada)
description: A full ripe and refreshingly fruity wine, this is full of grapefruit, apricot and ripe pear flavors. It has a touch of spice and a firmly mineral character. Drink now.

title: Château de Gaudou 2014 Tradition Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: The simplest and fruitiest of the Cahors made at Gaudou, this is still a structured wine that has some firm, very young tannins that need to round out. Plenty of fruity, fresh black-currant flavor is cut by crisp acidity. The wine will need to age, so drink from 2016.

title: Benoît Daridan 2014 Pinot Noir-Gamay (Cheverny)
description: Dominated by Pinot Noir, this is a tight and stalky wine. It is almost too light, with its acidity and tight tannins to the front. Probably as it softens it will round out, so wait until late 2016 to drink.

title: Benoît Daridan 2014 Rosé (Cheverny)
description: Made from Pinot Noir, this fresh and light rosé is packed with red berries and lively acidity. It is perfumed, dry and very fruity. Drink now.

title: Bodega Norton 2013 Barrel Select Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Big, blocky black-fruit aromas are reduced and potent. This is quite chunky and extracted in feel, with jammy gritty blackberry and plum flavors that are mildly herbal and simmer with heat and heft on the finish.

title: Bodega Renacer 2012 Enamore Red (Mendoza)
description: A grassy, herbal element is up front on the nose of this Amarone-style blend done in conjunction with Allegrini of the the Veneto (Italy). In the mouth, it's round as a ball, with syrupy richness. Ripe sticky berry and plum flavors finish chewy with residual stickiness.

title: Borsao 2014 Monte Oton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Cherry and raspberry aromas are spunky and simple in front of a crisp edgy palate. Medicinal, lightly rubbery flavors of cherry and plum finish with a raw rub, juicy acidity, a lean body and mild heat.

title: Coeur de Terre 2013 Oregon Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Scents softly suggest rose petals and milk chocolate, leading into a wine that seems to hit a hard stop midpalate. A clear flavor of cold steel resonates against a counterpoint of tart berry fruit.

title: Cummins Road 2012 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A hint of sweat in the nose blows away to reveal a solid core of cherry fruit, along with broad flavors of stem, coffee and earth. This wine is substantial, though that slightly funky character lingers into the finish.

title: Doña Paula 2013 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Woody and dense at first, this smells bright and fruity as it opens. A solid palate houses lightly toasted flavors of blackberry that turn more peppery and toasty on a fairly oaky finish.

title: Dr. Volkmar 2013 Kabinett Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Luscious honeyed tangerine and yellow peach notes are offset by a streak of minerality in this easy, off-dry Riesling. It's delicate in body yet juicy and refreshing. Drink now.

title: Domaine Gérard Duplessis 2014  Chablis
description: This is a fresh, open and very accessible wine. Crisp acidity cuts through the green apple flavors and tangy, mineral texture. With juicy fruitiness, it is a light wine that is ready to drink.

title: Enrique Foster 2014 Ique Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Despite showing a yellow color and gritty oiliness on the nose, this feels round and complete, with tropical flavors of mango, papaya and green melon. Everything about this is mild, inoffensive and tropical. Drink now before it starts to fade.

title: Mont Marçal 2011 Brut Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Popcorn and apple aromas ride highest on a lightly baked and toasty bouquet. This feels clean and correct, but basic. Flavors of spiced apple and melon blend with fresh celery and lettuce notes in front of a minerally lime-tinged finish.

title: Keller 2013 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Ripe butterscotch and a notable flank of big vanilla and oak greet the entry of this vineyard-designate. It makes for a luxurious wine reflective of a warm vintage and approach.

title: Orogeny 2013 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: The barrel speaks loudly here, fortressing deep, full-bodied layers of vanilla, tropical guava and pineapple. Creamy and textured, it finishes in more vanilla.

title: Myka 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This white is a mix of tropical pineapple, tangerine and marshmallow, offering a creamy, doughy and yeasty texture on the palate. Chalky, it is medium bodied with a hint of richness, finishing more steely than stuffy.

title: Negretti 2012  Barbera d'Alba Superiore
description: Aromas of mature plum, toasted oak, menthol and dried herb lead the nose. The firm palate offers blackberry jam, dried black cherry, Oriental spice and licorice alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent, mouth-drying finish.

title: Picardy 2012 Pinot Noir (Pemberton)
description: The Pannell family, who founded Margaret River's Moss Wood in 1969, moved on in the mid-1990s to Pemberton, where it felt conditions were more suited to Burgundian varieties. This is a rather full-bodied Pinot Noir, with supple tannins and a long, slightly dusty finish. Light resiny notes and rooty scents add complexity to modest cherry fruit. Drink now–2020.
